intro: Siphocampylus subglaber var. glaber, commonly known as the slender beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and are adapted for pollination by bees and other insects. The species is known for its drought tolerance and is often found in mountainous regions.
